As a result of neglecting the
T
-operator term in Eq. (71), the simplest electron-phonon Green's function ( Eq. (79)) does not depend on the distance
L
between the donor and the acceptor of the electron charge. The dependence on the distance
L
arises after integration over coordinates
q
of the electron in the transfer amplitude ( Eq. (64)). Therefore, the definition of the simplest Green's function for the elementary electron-charge transfers must include this integration.
